doc.field: New-York Historical Society collection of scrapbooks and clippings
New-York Historical Society collection of scrapbooks and clippings

7 volumes of newspaper clippings compiled by Lispenard Stewart (1855-1927) and centered on himself. The articles concern both his political career (he briefly held office as a state senator in New York, and was active in electoral politics and the Republican Party); his social activities, including dinners he hosted or attended, summers at Newport, etc.; social gossip, especially about his various rumored marriage engagements (he was a lifelong bachelor); his involvement with New York's prison commission; and other matters. Many of the articles also relate to his family, including his brother William Rhinelander Stewart (1852â€“1929). Source: Gift of William Rhinelander Stewart, November 17, 1928.
New-York Historical Society collection of scrapbooks and clippings
